content: We currently have OrderRingHom representing monotone semiring homomorphisms. Why not have an embedding version for the injective case?
↪+o would also be useful to me.

I'm not sure if adding more variants for embeddings like this is something we take lightly. My particular use case is casting from ordinals (with modified addition and multiplication) into games / surreal numbers (#15787). The former is an injective order-preserving commutative monoid homomorphism, and the latter is an injective order-preserving semiring homomorphism.
Obvious question: What is your use case? What will you be able to do with a f : Ordinal ↪+*o Game that you couldn't do with f : Ordinal →+*o Game + Injective f?
Really all I want is to automatically have the simp lemmas f x ≤ f y ↔ x ≤ y, etc. without having to write them down
Does that mean you want to define concrete functions as Ordinal ↪+*o Game? How many lemmas do you think will generalise?
Well, I want to define one concrete function
Honestly my use case is really minor, so I don't think this is worth it unless there are other use cases, or whether defining new structures like this has a similarly minor cost
Yeah I think the cost-benefit balance here is saying "Don't define ↪+*o"
